model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Parent, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker B: I've got very wet most days unfortunately but need to keep up with the exercise.  Been taking to the gym to keep dry.  When im not out in the surf of a morning first thing on the weekends, to avoid the crowds as you know im not too good at the surfing but its good fun. 

[MEMORY]
1. Speaker B does not have any trips planned but expresses interest in visiting Greece for the history and Greek mythology.
2. Speaker A is fascinated by the architecture of Italy and enjoys studying history, especially through reading and watching documentaries.
3. Speaker B enjoys Greek mythology and did a case study on Poseidon, the God of the Sea, Earthquakes, and Horses.
4. Speaker A is planning to travel to Italy alone for Spring Break and has friends from Europe meeting up with them.
5. Speaker B has been to Italy in the past and enjoyed the food there.
6. Speaker B has lived in California for 30 years and loves the weather and beaches there.
current_dialogue: Speaker B: I've got very wet most days unfortunately but need to keep up with the exercise.  Been taking to the gym to keep dry.  When im not out in the surf of a morning first thing on the weekends, to avoid the crowds as you know im not too good at the surfing but its good fun.

speaker: Parent
raw_prediction: That's dedication to keep up with your exercise routine, rain or shine! The gym sounds like a good alternative. Surfing must be a great way to start your weekends, even if you're still working on your skills. Do you have any favorite spots along the California coast for surfing?
